Detailed Description

Interface used to allow the creator of a dialog to run some code when the dialog is canceled.

The following example demonstrates how to use the IDialogOnCancelListener. 

  //You need implement your owner OnCancel Listener for Dialog
  class MyDialogOnCancelListener : gaia::core::IDialogOnCancelListener {
    public:
      MyDialogOnCancelListener();
      virtual ~MyDialogOnCancelListener();
      virtual void onCancel();
  };

  void MyDialogOnCancelListener::onCancel() {
      //When dialog is cancel, will use the callback to notify you.
      . . . .
  }

  //In your dialog, just register the callback by registerOnCancelListener
  MyDialogBox* dialog = new MyDialogBox(page);
  MyDialogOnCancelListener* listener = new MyDialogOnCancelListener();
  if (listener == NULL) {
      // DialogOnCancelListener create failure!!
      return;
  }

  if (dialog != NULL) {
    dialog->registerOnCancelListener(listener);
  }
